author: Special Correspondent
text:
Police and Static Surveillance Team, deputed for election work, seized 110 kg of ganja (cannabis) and arrested the driver even as two drug traffickers jumped out and escaped during vehicle checking at Parthibanur check-post near here on Tuesday evening.

Acting on a tipoff provided by the district unit of Organised Crime Intelligence Unit (OCIU), the police and the surveillance team intercepted the vehicle and arrested the driver with the contraband. Two others who were travelling in the vehicle escaped, police said, adding one of them was identified as Kumar (35).

The driver, K Thangapandian (27) of Peraiyur in the district, confessed to the police that one Jayalakshmi in Madurai (drug trafficker) had asked them to transport the bundle to Paramakudi and gave Rs. 5,000. They were told that a ‘contact’ would receive it at Paramakudi.

Sources in the OCIU said the contraband was being brought here to be smuggled to Sri Lanka via the sea route. Police registered a case and launched a hunt for the duo.
title: 110 kg of ganja seized, one held
